Text.Value: The Zhentarim have brought you nothing but trouble, Rugan. Cut your losses.
Aaand... nobody gives a shite. Should've left me there, mate - it would've been a kinder death than the others got.
As the last of the original Gate crew, my duty is to drink to fallen comrades. So... if'n you don't mind?
So if you don't mind - give me a little space, civilian.
Everyone, look! This is the one that delivered my soft and downy bum from a pack of gnolls!
Drunk on duty? Nice, Rugan.
Bugbear barman. Heh.
We returned to find new management among the Zhentarim in the city. They promptly turned us all over to the Steel Watch.
Leave.
Kinder than being torn apart by a pack of gnolls?
I'm not drunk. I've been drinking - and you would be too, if you'd seen what I have. The others were hanged.
I'm... tired. Reckon I'll take a break. Go... off duty for a while.
The Zhentarim sold your friends out. You think they wouldn't do the same to you?
Back on duty in a moment. Just... a moment.
Go on. I'm on duty.
So how is it you're still alive?
Oh, aye. I'm all luck these days, my friend.
Justice for that caravanserai and the kidnapped duke, apparently. Funny that we'd get done for the one bit of mischief that wasn't ours.
'Course. I'm owed back-pay. Not that there's much for me to do that these reinforcements from Darkhold don't have covered.
If you're wondering what we strapping Zhentarim are doing in a dump like this - that makes two of us, friend.
Either way, the new management didn't want the Watch looking our way. So the others were served up on a platter - an offering.
You.
The old hempen jig. Hanged.
Who is this 'new management'?
The other Zhentarim? What happened to them?
No idea. But whatever they're planning has impressed the powers-that-be at Darkhold, judging by the reinforcements.
There's no 'owing' with the Zhentarim, mate. There's just taking. Whoever's quickest, and meanest, and...
The Zhentarim made you turn on your people. You really think you owe them loyalty?
What can I say? I am exacting in my duty.
Good luck, Rugan.
Losses, mate? What exactly have I got left to lose? They won't even give me a post here.
I showed loyalty, so I got to walk away. As a - whatsit - a cautionary tale.
Aye. Aye, maybe you're right. Consider me officially off-duty.
Not if there was no profit in it, no. But then... our kind can find profit in anything.
You certainly smell like a cautionary tale, Rugan.
To Ronnie... Ozzy... What the hells was his name...?
How d'you think? I turned informer. Fed every lie and accusation back to them: 'Yes, sir - I saw them do it all.'
I've been Black Network for as long as I remember. I've been loyal. Few bumps in the road don't change that.
And after all that, you're still working for the Zhentarim?
Wha...? Was there a fight or something?
Leave.
Well. Maybe the wine has clouded my wits a bit there. But the others were hanged - a nasty way to go.

Synopsis:
Rugan will only appear in the Guildhall if we successfully rescued him and sent him on his way with the other Zhent in Act 1, shipment intact. He's not holding a drink, but is a little tipsy throughout. Merry drunk masking pain.
He tells us how all those others were betrayed and executed in a Zhentish power play, and he only survived because he gave false evidence. We can convince him to leave the Zhent, at which point he'll head over to the bar and miss any combat.
